original: @19a * // 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: @19a * // 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rnal 'byor bas ci za ba'i zas kyi rnal 'byor 'di ltar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rnal 'byor bas ci za ba'i zas kyi rnal 'byor 'di ltar bya'o //
translated: The yoga of eating food should be done in this way by one who is a yogin of the recitation of the names.

original: gang yang zas kyi dngos po stong par bsams te /
analyzed: gang yang zas kyi dngos po stong par bsams te /
translated: Whatever food one has, one should imagine it to be empty.

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'a dya nu tpanna tv'a ta sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'a dya nu tpanna tv'a ta sv'a h'a /
translated: Om akaro mukhaṃ sarvadharmāṇām ādyanutpannatvāta svāhā.

original: zhes pas dag par bsams la /
analyzed: zhes pas dag par bsams la /
translated: Having imagined it to be pure,

original: a'a: yongs su gyur pa las bdud rtsi dkar po dri ma med pa dang / aom yongs su gyur pa las mang zhing spel ba dang / h'um gis ye shes kyi bdud rtsi drangs te /
analyzed: a'a: yongs su gyur pa las bdud rtsi dkar po dri ma med pa dang / aom yongs su gyur pa las mang zhing spel ba dang / h'um gis ye shes kyi bdud rtsi drangs te /
translated: from the transformation of āḥ, there is stainless white nectar; from the transformation of oṃ, there is an increase and expansion; and from hūṃ, the nectar of gnosis is drawn.

original: bdag gi lce rdo rjer bsams la /
analyzed: bdag gi lce rdo rjer bsams la /
translated: One should imagine one’s tongue to be a vajra.

original: lus ngag yid gsum byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Having consecrated one’s body, speech, and mind,

original: snying gar lha tshogs gsal btab la dang por dkon mchog mchod /
analyzed: snying gar lha tshogs gsal btab la dang por dkon mchog mchod /
translated: one should visualize the assembly of deities in one’s heart. First, one should make offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: de nas lha tshogs ci rigs par mchod la /
analyzed: de nas lha tshogs ci rigs par mchod la /
translated: Then, one should make offerings to the assembly of deities as appropriate.

original: rang gi lus kyi lha tshogs tshim par byas la /
analyzed: rang gi lus kyi lha tshogs tshim par byas la /
translated: One should satisfy the assembly of deities in one’s body.

original: lhag ma 'byung po kun la sbyin no //
analyzed: lhag ma 'byung po kun la sbyin no //
translated: The rest is given to all the bhūtas.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i zas kyi @19b rnal 'byor slob dpon 'jam dpal bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i zas kyi @19b rnal 'byor slob dpon 'jam dpal bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so//
translated: The yoga of the food of the Praise in One Hundred and Eight Names is complete.
